website_summaries.verdict: Gas-powered, professional-grade tool that is suitable for users of all experience levels. The best available.
pros: Can be worn like a backpack for easy maneuvering
A powerhouse machine with a large gas tank
cons: Heavy (22 pounds), but weight is distributed evenly inside backpack

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not as strong as the average electric blower. The tube is cheap and will come apart. Think twice before buying it. Amazon will not return/exchange/ or refund. They will not tell you this during the buy process. If you have any thought of buying this go to your local brick and mortar store to buy it. That way you have options when it does not fulfill your needs. 100% do not buy. Manufacturer will not assist. This is my first Amazon review, it was that aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: Extended warranty may not be honored
customer_reviews.text: If you're purchasing the leaf blower and fuel with the hopes of getting the extended warranty, keep in mind that if both things aren't fulfilled by Amazon, the orders will be split and will appear on different invoices. According to Husqvarna's terms for the extended warranty, both the leaf blower and the fuel must appear on the same invoice, otherwise the extended warranty will not be honored. I haven't needed any warranty service, so I can't say if Husqvarna would deny the claim, but chances are they'd deny it because the purchase didn't follow their terms (even though they were both part of the same order).
customer_reviews.author: beaker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Same problem as a lot of the other 1 star reviews. I’ve never been able to use it at more than 50% power. I brought it to authorized service center and they charged me because they said gas was bad. The gas was 2 weeks old. It worked for a week after they “fixed” it. I tried non ethonal premix gas and still doesn’t work. In addition, I hear a faint rattle sound that sounds like it’s in the engine someplace like a loose screw or nut floating around. I bought Husqvarna because of its reputation but apparently not so good anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: Broken Clamp for Throttle Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Very concerned about the quality of this blower based on the very flimsy clamp that holds the throttle assembly to the blower tube. It cracked in half as I was trying to assemble it. I hope this isn't indicative of the overall quality of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Husky product, and they are all the hardest starting machines I've ever had. This blower took ten pulls to start out of the box and sometimes will not start at all until I give it a several hour break and try again. Once started, it doesn't seem to have much more power than my 20 year old Homelite hand held blower. I wish I had spent the extra money to get a Stihl. Warranty service is an hour drive away and didn't seem to think this was a problem when I spoke to them on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Better Options
customer_reviews.text: Favorite Quality is that it is quieter than most. But there are things I hate about it. Priming Bulb out of site and hard to find. its awkward to start - when you need to restart a hot engine, you want to place your left hand on it to start, but obviously you can't. while it does have a waist belt, it NEEDS a chest strap. not all users are the same size! ANd the throttle handle sits too far back. i have what i think is a shorter arm than most and its uncomfortable. And it's heavy. I'm sorry I bought this model. But that's just me...
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Lauder

customer_reviews.title: Works very well with lots of power.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first backpack blower configuration. I am very pleased with the quality and the power. It will blow away everything! There is one thing about backpack blowers I had not considered. With a handheld blower, you can change hands to keep from having issues with long term use. You do not have that option with backpack blowers. You can get right or left handed ones, but they are not ambidextrous. They are also better in larger open areas as they're larger and harder to manipulate in smaller areas. Husqvarna 350BT is a beast of a machine. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Creager

customer_reviews.title: Bit heavy and difficult to start
customer_reviews.text: I was using a hand held blower, but it died after a couple months. I bought this thinking I needed something more durable. My feelings are: 1. Its heavy - Not easy to just pick up and do a quick job. I find myself avoiding using it for the smaller tasks I would use a handheld for. 2. Its not easy to get started. Its got some torq against the pull cord. I am generally pulling the cord 6-7 times and adjusting the choke and throttle to keep it running. The pullcord is also short making me feel like it is going to rip out in the future on a pull.
customer_reviews.author: Geode

customer_reviews.title: Smooth & Quiet Operation.
customer_reviews.text: I use this commercially, and compared to the others that I’ve used in the past... this is much smoother and quieter than I expected. I’ve used other products that have a real rough vibration while revved up on your back, and that isn’t the case for this one. It’s also quieter than I expected, but I still use hearing protection anyway. Tips for cold starting: 1. Prime bulb 5x 2. Throttle half way (full works too) 3. Push choke lever down 4. It’ll start on second pull. After it’s warm, it’ll start on first pull after you proceed from Step 2.
customer_reviews.author: prevent ت

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is easy. Use the recommended octane and good 2 cycle oil. Put it together while a rain shower came through. Fired it up just to test it. Had wet "helicopters" from a sugar maple on the driveway and it blew them away! I use 2" river rock for landscaping and it blew them clean even when damp plus moving a couple rocks..It is a touch heavy, but after 5 minutes, you do not notice. I'm old school so I don't run a fresh engine past half throttle and this thing still did the job. This thing would blow the stink off a billy goat! I'll do a follow up in a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. Long

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this blower
customer_reviews.text: Worked for almost one season and the will not start anymore. After checking things out I am getting no spark. A new spark plug did not help so I am assuming that it is the coil (edit: turns out it was the carburetor). I can't believe it broke already, this is ridiculous. Also the blowing power on this model leaves a lot to be desired. After my experience with this, I'm not sure where Husqvarna gets its high reputation.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Best leaf blower that I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: This thing ROCKS. I bought this after my husband came hone from a friends cabin and he tried it out blowing out leaves from around the building. I got it thinking that it must be pretty powerful since we’ve owned 2 leaf blowers before and they both lacked the “juice” needed to blow out the pine needles around our own cabin. Holy cats! This thing is amazing. I was able to blow out “junk” that was never able to dislodge from the rocks and gullies around the cabin. This blower has amazing strength and isn’t heavy like other blowers. It’s gas-run so you are not confined to the length of the cord like other blowers. I ABSOLUTELY recommend this blower
customer_reviews.author: Beth Battaglia

customer_reviews.title: Not for commercial use.
customer_reviews.text: I actually have owned 4 of these. Usually I'm a fan a Husqvarna products, and I've owned a total of 4 of this particular model of backpack blower. The first 2 were great and the first model still runs great. The last 3 have been prone to ignition coil failures. I currently have 2 that have failed so many times that I have quit fixing them. The failure generally occurs when I'm blowing multiple properties in a row on hot days. So if your looking for a blower for just your personal property you should be fine, but this in not good choice for commercial use.
customer_reviews.author: James U.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to start. You have to put it on the ground and it takes about 15 pulls with my foot on it to get it started. Then it has to remain blowing while you struggle to get in the harness. Very dangerous. Need at least two people and even then it's difficult. Now it is even worse. It won't start at all!!! A total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: TheDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Do  not buy this blower
customer_reviews.text: this blower comes with a disposable carburator that only works for about 6 times and then does not work. Husqvarna does not stand behind their product and refuses to give me my money back or admit there are issues with this blower. i am seriously thinking of suing them now just for the principle. i just had the fourth one put in along with a coil and it only worked for four sessions then crapped out. i am so frustrated. i have , lawnmowers, weed wackers , chainsaws, quads, motorcycles etc. so i believe i know how to take care of my equipment. bad gas??????? water in the gas????? not true. just an all around bad machine.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Azar

customer_reviews.title: Great product, get it!
customer_reviews.text: I worked in landscaping for the past two years using Stihl backpack blowers. This starts on the second pull every time. It has great power. I can clean gutters easily, clear large amounts of grass clippings and leaves...I have 16 acres of trails and a couple acres I keep manicured. I look forward to clearing my decks and side walk in the Winter with it. If you’re on the fence...pick this one for sure.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyZ

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a hunk of crap. All seemed well at first, right out outta the box and tested it for 5 min and it worked. The next day went to use it, and it had no blow power, would die when pressing on the throttle. So since my husband had gotten rid of the box (because god forbid you hold on to something) we found a local shop that did warranty work. A week later they tell us they got it to work, something mustve worked its way though the lines. So we take it home, get an hr use out of it, and its doing it again! Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had a hand held 4 stroke makita blower and it did ok, but wanted something a bit more powerful and the 350BT has fit the bill!! Easy to assemble and starts right away. It had rained a lot and the front yard was full of heavy, wet leaves. The makita would have had issues with those leaves, but not the 350BT......not a problem at all!! Very comfortable on the back....very easy to use. My only complaint is its a 2 stroke, so have to buy an extra jerry can and the 2 stroke oil, but it is worth it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: flames9

customer_reviews.title: A mans tool, more power!
customer_reviews.text: Man I had no idea how much power this thing had, I used a hand gas blower and before that an electric corded version. This thing is nascar over bicycle power in difference! Once started and thrown over the shoulder you dont notice it at all, comfortable, no vibration problems like my old handhelds... extremely happy. This thing is thirsty but if you need to move boulders by wind power alone, no sweat this is the tool. Works well as a kids propulsion tool on a skateboard, swivel chair, john boat propulsion... limitless 😉
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Easy start, adjustable control grip
customer_reviews.text: It feels a little heavier than another unit I have used so far. It started easily and the cruise control feature helps to lessen the hand fatigue. The extension tubes, one did not fit at all but the other three pieces were easy to install and it was enough for the job because I'm 5'8". The engine noise is a little bit quieter than the one I used but not too significant. The max speed is average but just enough to blow leaves and debris away. It works well to clear 1/2 acre land with minimum vibration.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Prime

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this blower
customer_reviews.text: Used this leaf blower once weekly for about a year and it stopped working. I expected better from this blower. It starts but bogs down and ultimately stalls out when giving it any throttle. I replaced the fuel filter to no avail. Sure I can replace the carburator for $100, but I think I'd rather just buy a blower that isn't so expensive to maintain or one that I can service myself. Thanks for the headache.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Gave it a second chance and now I give up. Never buying Husq again.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Husqvarna leaf blower I have purchased in 4 years. The first one stopped working and the repair shop couldn't fix it for a reasonable price because the parts changed. I opened the new one today and put gas in it. It ran for 1 hour and I had to refill the tank. And now I have spent 4 hours trying to get a brand new leaf blower to start again. I am dumping the gas and it is going right back to Husqvanra. Total crap.
customer_reviews.author: ibuytoomuchstuff

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Blower
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace two electric blowers that were too weak (battery) and cumbersome (plugin) to use. This backpack blower is awesome! It is easy to start, and wear (I'm 6' 3") and is very effective at blowing grass, leaves, maple tree "helicopter" seeds, and dirt. I have to be careful to not blow the rocks out of the flower beds, but the throttle control makes this easy. I'm very pleased with this blower!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Husky products rock
customer_reviews.text: Rented a ST***L from the local shop to see if the backpack would work. It did. I bought the Husky based on how well I like my chainsaw. The backpack has not disappointed. Lighter and more powerful than the rental unit. Always starts on 2nd or 3rd pull. Pulls are easy. Powerful blower. Not terribly loud as blowers go. I do wear earplugs though, but not sure if they are really needed. Just seems like a good idea. Used all season, no troubles at all.
customer_reviews.author: The Ops Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Blows up a storm!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Husqvarna blower vac I have purchased. First one lasted 15+ years then gave it to my son-in-law for his yard work. Easy to start, well balanced on my back, and blows up a real storm! I live in a heavily wooded area with LOTS of leaves to deal with in the fall. I probably spend a total of 12 - 15 hours over 4 weeks blowing leaves. This unit is dependable (like to older one I had) and I expect many years of service from it. A great backpack blower at a reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd4Al

customer_reviews.title: I hate this blower.
customer_reviews.text: Had it fir a few years but it has very low hours. It's nearly new out of the box. Why? it never starts. getting it started is a nightmare. cleaning the carb is impossible without destroying it. It never started well even the first time I used it. Enjoy your money. I will never purchase another Husqvarna product again. Not a sewing machine, not a tamping rammer, not a chainsaw, not a mower (and I fix mowers).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great hasqvarna product.
customer_reviews.text: this is a great, well built higher quality backpack blower. itisn't the lightest product out ther, but it also isn't one of the cheaper "homeowner" versions either. i read through loads of reviews and independent product comparisons and this item was constantly rated over the comprable stihl unit. in fairness the rastings and reviews were always very close, but the product reviewers always seemed to give the lean to the hasqvarna product. i have several hasqvarna devices and have found them to be great quality and durable products. i would buy this unit again and would recommend it to those looking for a better quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Blower is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Husqvarna 350BT blower really does the job clearing leaves on our wooded lot. My husband put it together easily and followed the directions to start the engine with no issue. He needs to fine tune his backpack strap adjustments to maintain a comfortable position. Overall this blower is amazing compared to the light duty one we're replacing. We also purchased the premixed fuel for the extended warranty deal and registered the blower online. Husqvarna sent me an email with directions to mail the receipt for both blower and fuel for the extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredRVer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best blower ever,
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blower ever, It is a bit heavy to carry but once you have it on your back, it is very comfortable. Having the belt makes a big difference in comfort. I had it on my back for 2 hours and didn't have any problem with it and I am a 68 year old female. This blower was able to blow the wet leaves out of the ivy. These leaves were in the ivy for several years so they were pretty packed down.
customer_reviews.author: mammogramma

customer_reviews.title: This 350BT blower is the one you want!
customer_reviews.text: 2018 UPDATE: We have used this Husqvarna 350T for five years now. We maintain 30 lawns and use this blower for 2-5 lawns each day from April to October. It still starts on the second pull and will move cut grass and leaves with ease. Can't say enough about the way this blower keeps on going and going like the energizer bunny. 2012: We use this blower every day in summer, maintaining 30 different residences. It starts and runs every time. Moves leaves, and clippings right now. No reservations, this is the one you want! Yes, it's a bit heavy, but once it's running and on your back it is easy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Burou

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box, assembled in minutes, and filled with brand new 50:1 gas. I was hoping for significantly more power than my 58v hand-held electric blower but was disappointed after clearing my yard. The 350bt has power but just not like the commercial models that can clear the ivy.
customer_reviews.author: Jschwartzott

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not even comparable to 570BTS
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I thought it was same as one I rented...I rented the Husqvarna 570BTS and used it in spring for massive wet leaf piles that I intended to move before snow and never did. The 570 was amazing...this one not so much. I would say it's about 3x power of my batt blower. Was able to clear my driveway of sand/dirt and cut grass/sticks in about 15min but with 570 I would have been done in 5 so that's an easy choice for me. Didn't want to spend $500 but for an extra $150 I'd rather have one I love and keep it for years.
customer_reviews.author: DealHaggler

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a 125x150 lot, covered in leaves...couldn't even see the grass. In a little over 4hrs, was able to clear it all and blow it to the curb. Very comfortable to use, seems heavy at first but get used to it quick. I think the gas tank is big enough...a full tank at max power gave me about 2hrs and change. My yard needed just 3 tank full of gas. Recommend getting yourself a good pair of over the ear muffs to protect yourself. Very pleased and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AntJustAnt

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: Lighter than i expected. Starts easily. I love the throttle lock so i don't have to keep the trigger held all the time. Only bad things about it is the gas prime bubble is not easy to find or access and if you accidentally turn off the blower with your hand controls you have to take off the blower to restart. I have about 4 miles of road at our campground and it only takes 1.5 tanks of gas to do all the leaf/pine needle clearing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Ashwood Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived today, started after a few pulls, ran great. Plenty of power for residential use. I ran it two hours, straight out of the box during spring clean up. The price seems to change daily ($319 one day, $280 the next, then $262 two days later, then $319 again?) but it's a solid blower. Shoulder straps are comfortable, seems to be a rugged machine, plenty of power pushing small sticks, rocks, dirt and wet leaves with ease. Aside from the price variations, I'm happy with it. With ear plugs, not too loud. Yes... Wear ear and eye protection! Shipping was fast and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Helps me a lot...
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived with a broken Control Handle clamp. Amazon took care of that like always and I really appreciate it. Took me a good while before deciding on this particular one. There's a few brands that I was considering because it has 5 acres filled with leaves to take care of during fall and spring time. Tough choice but I think I made the right decision. It handles really well. For now it deserves 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Czeal001

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay on when not in choke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product - diligently follower all instructions provided. The blower stalls out when not in choke. I contacted customer service through the web. They closed the question without offering a response. Really horrible customer service when you buy a $300+ product.
customer_reviews.author: H. T. Philip

customer_reviews.title: Can't start it
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this. It's useless to me because I can't start it. The cord always seems to be stuck or something. My husband has had trouble starting it too but did get it going once. It's been raining on weekends so he hasn't had time to do the leaves. I'd like to help but I can't get it started at all. I want him to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Doherty

customer_reviews.title: I am a 60+ woman and this was easy to operate & not too heavy to manage
customer_reviews.text: What a workhorse!! I am a 60+ woman and this was easy to operate & not too heavy to manage. I was able to clean up my 5 acre property surrounded by large mature trees in a couple hours - used to take at least an entire day with my previous blower!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sallie

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy but a great blower
customer_reviews.text: This blower is great. IT is a little heavy for my wife and daughters but is great for blowing leaves and grass and drying my car when I need it. Would definitely suggest this backpack blower. Once you get it on your shoulders the weight goes away.
customer_reviews.author: Brutus

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT!!! One small problem was the screw holding the 'throttle" circular housing piece fell out and was lost. I used gorilla tape to hold it together. Works fine, but would rather have the screw. I and and old man of 84 and yet had not problem at all with starting, it heaving it onto my shoulder to harness up, or operate it for a couple of hours all on one tank of gas. Love, it, kicking myself for not getting it years ago. I have many live oak trees that shed every leaf each spring - rake rake rake - the blower does much of the work fo rme.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Moore

customer_reviews.title: So far I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: I only got to use this a few times this fall but it did a pretty good job for me. It's heavier than my last backpack blower but the straps a belt harness make it less fatigueing that the old one. Has great power for a home blower. Only complaint I can think of is it ships in the manufacturer's box, so if your worried about porch pirates be home for delivery.
customer_reviews.author: q

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: A bit heavier than I anticipated. It’s a must to use the waist belt to help with that. I do find it requires a bit of strength to pull the cord too (I am a 5’4” 57 year old woman). But... I get it started and It doesn’t kill me to lug it around my 1/2 acre. I like the power and it effectively does what I need it to do. Autumn will be the real test. I did not have any problems with assembly.
customer_reviews.author: greenlady

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased this at the 299 price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not a Honda engine. It takes a few pulls to get it running. It does a fairly good job blowing leaves. Has some trouble with the wet leaves. Ran over an hour on the tank of gas. Only used it once so far. Leaves are still coming down. Working about half of my lawn every few days.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Pelletier

customer_reviews.title: It was actually fun! Very powerful, will move mountains of leaves.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what you need with a decent sized yard. We are in a forest with .8 acre. Don't point it anywhere by accident, trust me! My neighbors were raking and burning leaves over and over for weeks. I just waited till the trees were done and blew all the leaves to the back of the property in a couple of hours. Yard was clean as a whistle, no back pain. It was actually fun! Very powerful, will move mountains of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Crockett

customer_reviews.title: I seems to do a good job cleaning the driveway.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to clean the driveway after mowing and it does a good job. This is not the sellers fault, but i had to put it in the shop after I put it together because it would only idle. A piece was defective in the handle and would not make it blow. It was repaired under warranty. It came quickly and was just as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 350BT!
customer_reviews.text: This blower is awesome! A time saver. Can be used for more than just blowing off driveways. The power is there when you need it. Get the right tool for the job even if it costs you a little more up front. So many people I know that have Husqvarna products last 7-9+ years using the correct fuel and performing a proper maintenance schedule. You can buy cheap models from other companies but they won’t last. I will continue to buy other Husqvarna products from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a forest. In the fall, I can get 6-8" of leaves every week. This has been a work horse on my 1+ acre lot. Cut my time from 8-12hrs with electric hand blower to 3hrs or less if they're dry. Starts 1st try and easy to use. Even started to help my elderly neighbors with theirs with all the extra time I have now. Money well spent. Wasted lots of time for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Senior

customer_reviews.title: Starts Right Away Every Time
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as powerful as old 400 Stihl backpack blower it replaced, but this is being nitpicky -- does well. Starts more reliably than the Stihl did and plenty powerful to blow the leaves off a half acre. Seems lighter in weight and more efficient than the old Stihl and grip is more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: NickNC100

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: The unit starts easily, has all the power I need and the controls are readily accessible. The shoulder straps and waist belt are adjustable for weight distribution. Only con is the unit weight. But I knew that going in. I use the unit for blower down roads and paths at a lake property and collecting leaves for burning.
customer_reviews.author: DON F.

customer_reviews.title: Started on the very first pull!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with 2-day Prime membership. Trivial "assembly". Put pre-mixed oil/gas into it (I also have a Husky trimmer), pushed the primer bulb 3 times, put on the choke, and gave it my first tentative pull, just to loosen it up before actually trying to start it -- and the damned thing started right up!!! Put it on my back and was blowing clippings off my driveway within 15 minutes of opening the box. Impressive power ... almost never need full throttle. As others have said, kind of heavy, but the backpack harness is comfortable if adjusted properly (use the waist band to keep most of the weight on your hips rather than your shoulders).
customer_reviews.author: Gregory T Reid

customer_reviews.title: so good. Engine seems to need a slight carb adjustment ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Engine seems to need a slight carb adjustment to completely smooth out but that might get better with use. Not much improvement over Poulan Pro hand-held for velocity and ease of pointing, but less tiring by being back-carried, and hopefully more durable than the short-lived Poulan Pro. I've had five of them, maybe good for two seasons. The last two locked up and the local service center is a joke! I paid more for the 350BT and am counting on a LOT more. We shall see. This is too heavy and hard to get on one's back for a typical housewife, so if she needs something for light work, better get her something else.
customer_reviews.author: wellmaybe

customer_reviews.title: FAULT ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Leaft Blower and it advertized that if I buy Husqvarna Pre-Mix 950ml I will get 5 years warranty - but when I went to the website for warranty it never give me option to get 5 yrs warranty. I called customer service for at least 10 times but never get connect !!! BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE and THE SELLER FOR THIS MISLED ADVERTIZING
customer_reviews.author: Thang

customer_reviews.title: Powerful cleanup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who has a huge Maple tree in his back yard. He couldn't be more pleased. He's not a yard guy so this made the job a cinch. Powerful enough to move those stubborn wet leaves. A job that would have taken him all day was reduced to a couple of hours. This is a well thought out backpack blower. The description on the details of what's included are accurate. I recommend this equipment to anyone who wants a clean lawn without all the fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Petowya

customer_reviews.title: Great Blower
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was hoping for. Just bought a house on 1 acre in the woods. Oak leaves everywhere. Thing blower is easy to start and very comfortable to wear. Everything about it worked like a charm. Bought with Husqvarna premixed fuel and doubled warranty during online registration. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S.

customer_reviews.title: A nice product For what what I paid
customer_reviews.text: It has nice power but it is always a two pull start. The blower hose feels cheap and broke in the first 6 weeks. The back pack is comfortable and well balanced. It was good deal for a backpack blower.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Blower Stopped Working after 3x
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to start. Not built to last. Used the blower 3x before it stopped working completely. Our yard is decent size, but not huge. About half acre. Thought maybe it over heated, but once it died, it no longer worked at all. Past the amazon return policy. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Findingmyfire

customer_reviews.title: and actually enjoyed clearing the yard of leaves
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this leaf blower for our home and have benefited from it quite a lot during the recent fall. I popped it in the car and took it to a seasonal property some distance away...and actually enjoyed clearing the yard of leaves...and in a very short time. It runs great and does a terrific job.
customer_reviews.author: Theoden

customer_reviews.title: The reviews were correct-- this is an amazing blower and well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were correct-- this is an amazing blower and well worth the money! I blew my whole yard yesterday and didn't hurt at all after carrying this thing around for two hours. That's a much different feeling than I had when toting around the handheld blower. Also, I purchased here on Amazon and ended up saving about $50 versus purchasing at a local hardware store (Lowes).
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Love my new leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: Had a Craftsman handheld leaf blower for years. This year it wouldn't start. I'm sure I could have given it a tune-up to get it going again, but I saw this as a great excuse to get a back-pack style blower. It arrived just ahead of hurricane Sandy. I was impressed by the comfort, low noise (compared to my old blower), and comparatively low emissions. I have done two yard clean-ups with the new blower, one pre-storm and one post. I am quite pleased: plenty of power, love the throttle on the hose arm, very comfortable. It was way more expensive than a handheld blower, but well worth the additional cost. Why hadn't I purchased one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: ElStar

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just received the blower and it was easy to assemble and started quick. It is light weight and powerful but we have limited use until the fall. The price was $40 cheaper then anywhere else, brand new, undamaged, and shipping was extremely fast.
customer_reviews.author: J. Loucks

customer_reviews.title: Minor negative points but overall a great machine!
customer_reviews.text: The mating of the tube sections is a bit wonky but once assembled it works very well starting easily on the first or second pull. Another thing I wish was different is that it would be nice to have something on the frame that one could stand on while starting. Currently I catch one of the straps under my foot while trying to start it but I'd rather not be stepping on the belts as they will wear out faster over time. Other than that and getting it put together, running quieter and with less vibration than other blowers I've tried makes this a winner in my book!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Schultz

customer_reviews.title: 3 months in and I’m happy.
customer_reviews.text: Starts on the 2nd or 3rd pull. Comfortable to wear. Not too loud. It’s my first backpack blower and I use it a couple of hours per week. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved the first unit I purchased
customer_reviews.text: I loved the first unit I purchased, very powerful for a "home" "non-industrial" unit. My son borrowed it a few times and said it significantly more powerful than his handheld unit so we bought him one for his birthday. Keep the gas fresh, use Stabil to help offset the ethanol and change the plug annually and this product will give you years of excellent service. I've had mine three years and it is still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: ptskywaker

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: My husband didn't complain about blowing the leaves in our huge yard this year after I ordered this backpack gas leaf blower. Our new home is surrounded by huge oak and maple trees and when all the leaves have fallen they are knee deep or more. We used an electric leaf blower for years and had to deal with a half dozen extension cords and still couldn't reach all areas of the huge yard. He even did our neighbors yard! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 350BT review
customer_reviews.text: This machine will BLOW! Very pleased with the blowing aspect of the 350BT but there are a few things that could be better. The worst thing is the plastic clamp that holds the hand trigger, its cheap, easy to break. Attaching this clamp you must be VERY careful not to get it to tight or it will break. The machine cranks about the second or third pull, the pull is a littler harder than I expected. All in all the machine does a great job of blowing and I would buy it again. After thought: The bulb that pumps gas into the carb is in a very bad position to find and get to. Still an excellent machine over all.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Adkisson

customer_reviews.title: Best blower
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant at first due to price, was tired of the wired ones. Then tried electric one, couldn't finish the job as charge would be out in about 40-50 minutes. Then I bought this one. It is the very best, really powerful and not too heavy, can do the job all day long. BEST investment for a blower. Just get it and you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gathogo

customer_reviews.title: The Husqvarna 350BT does the job!
customer_reviews.text: My preference was to purchase a backpack type leaf blower, instead of the hand held device. This is about 22.5 pounds, and easily supports an hour or more of work mounted on your back. The Husqvarna 350BT did not disappoint. It is powerful enough to shepherd most, if not all of your leaves into a nice pile if you wish. In order to extend its warranty for 6 more months (above the already provided mfg’s warranty), I purchased the 50:1 gas mixture sold by Husqvarna, it’s expensive, but this is my leaf clean-up investment. In addition, if you’re left handed, note that the blower nozzle is right handed mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Cericg09

customer_reviews.title: Powerful blower for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Starts easy and powerful. A little cumbersome to put on back with the straps but can do.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: High powered
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband and had exceeded our expectations. We have 25 ancient oaks on our property and the leaf situation is a real issue. This blower gets things under control and quickly. The only minus is that it’s a gas guzzler but that’s to be expected, I suppose. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LauraSNS

customer_reviews.title: This thing blows!
customer_reviews.text: Very well in fact. It made short work of our two acres of leaves. I wouldn't call it light weight, but it's manageable. The price was pretty decent. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but not much more
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, loud, large and less “blow” than I had expected. I have an Echo handheld that “blows” nearly the same amount and that consumes about 1/4 the fuel as this bohemouth.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: I have tried the unit during 7 hours of continuous operation in my heavily forested area and was pleased with its performance. It is not too heavy yet it is powerful enough for pretty much every residential application. It is fairly ergonomic as my injured back did not suffer from working full day on a fairly steep slope. I highly recommend the unit. The only con, in my opinion is lack of the chest strap to keep shoulder harness from slipping off your shoulders. I will have to improvise to add this feature on my own.
customer_reviews.author: BeeToyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent leaf blower for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent leaf blower for the price. Started on the second pull out of the box. Plenty of air volume and velocity, engine runs smooth at speed. Please remember to use Trufuel or similar non-ethanol fuel in your small engines. My husky chainsaw was much happier after I switched.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Good blower
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1/2 acre lot. Worked very well. First backpack blower I've ever used. Moves leaves very well. Hopefully the name and price point is the first and last blower I need to buy which was my plan when purchasing. Works great for residential but I've seen companies use this model for commercial.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliaqbility
customer_reviews.text: The 350BT works well in gathering up a combination or wet leave and pine needles with its powerful engine that starts with two pulls of the starer rope maximum. I have owned Husqvarna products for ten years because of their reliability; however, they must be maintained. My last hand-held blower lasted five years because I USED ethanol mixed gas and two cycle oil; I now pay the extra money for pre-mixed fuel purchased at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Powell, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great blower. Easy to use. It’ll blow just about anything out of your yard. Use the manufacturer’s premix premium fuel and oil mixture and your more than ready to with no worries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really excited to use this more
customer_reviews.text: Had some difficulty putting the handheld together, but once I got it going it worked great. Had to pull a few times to get the engine to start but otherwise gave a ton of power
customer_reviews.author: Jen S.

customer_reviews.title: A very fine piece of equipment. Well enginerred and thougt out.
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using a 200MPH electric leaf blower to clean a 150ft driveway and maybe 1/2 acers of trees. The total hassle of extension cords finally got the best of me and I decided I needed a back-pack type leaf blower. Although I haven't used it for leaves yet, I have used it to clean my driveway and it works great. A bit heavy at first but man does it do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Donald M.

customer_reviews.title: So long rake!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is expensive but such a great tool. Way too powerful for blowing leaves out of the flower beds as it will uproot the plants, but great for it's intended purpose of blowing leaves off the grass, sidewalk, driveway, etc. Needed a powerful blower to blow leaves all the way from front and side yard, to the end of the back yard, over an acre, and this does the job very nicely. So long rake!
customer_reviews.author: Lauter002

customer_reviews.title: Blows like crazy!
customer_reviews.text: Makes yard work much more fun. Starts great too! It is a little heavy for a 57 year old man, mainly getting it on your shoulders or carrying it through the garage with your hands to take it outside to crank. Easy to use and fun too. Blows like crazy and as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jigsaw John

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this new leaf blower... The reviews everywhere online weren't wrong... It is super powerful and easy to use. It is comfortable and here's the job done in our yard that has more trees than grass! No more than a half hour to do entire front yard. This should be in everyone's list!
customer_reviews.author: dawn g.

customer_reviews.title: Poor engine quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchase unit 2.5 years ago. Have experienced a lot of problems with motor (will not run at greater than 50% speed). Always use ethanol free gas and take care of my equipment. Have replaced air filter, gas filter, spark plug, carb, and made sure spark arrestor not fouled. Still not able to run full speed. Google this model and this problem before buying. Pretty wide spread. Faced with a big bill taking unit to small engine repair shop or buying another new unit. Probably will just buy a better brand. No more Husqvarna products for me!
customer_reviews.author: William L. Molair II

customer_reviews.title: Nice blower
customer_reviews.text: Really great, starts up easy, runs without cutting off. I've only used Husqvarna pre mixed fuel. This thing is great. I've used it for a few hours at this point.
customer_reviews.author: James Roberson

customer_reviews.title: YES!
customer_reviews.text: This blower is awesome. Works VERY well on 2 acre wooded lot. Best Christmas present I have ever gotten myself! PS: Worth buying the overpriced brand name pre-mixed fuel in same order to extend your warranty (and hit the ground blowing asap).
customer_reviews.author: wtrgrl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.text: It has great power but it started falling apart as soon as I used it. The exhaust pipes won't stay on, so every 2-3 minutes they fall off and the piece that holds the controls on fell off at some point so then I had to hold the control handle in my left hand and control the pipes with my right, which basically makes it no better than my $50 blower. I'm super frustrated with this product after spending $319 on it. I expected much more.
customer_reviews.author: Libby Villavicencio

customer_reviews.title: Everyone with lots of leaves needs a backpack blower!
customer_reviews.text: I debated if buying a backpack blower was worth the money... that was foolish. I picked this one because of the airspeed and it has been plenty for my big piles of leaves. Once you develop a technique/pattern that works for your yard, the power and ease of use of this machine make quick work of a yard of leaves. engine starts easily and reliably. My only slight complaint is that it's easy to accidentally flip the throttle into the kill position and then you have to take the whole thing off to restart it.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Solid blower. I bit heavy. I’m 6’4”, 265. It reminds me of wearing my Army rucksack. Not sure of the exact wait, but easily 25 lbs. probably too heavy for the average woman.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great blower. This unit is replacing a handheld husqvarna 125B that wasn't quite doing the job with a very long driveway and large leaves. The difference between the two is night and day. Yes this blower is over twice the price of the handheld but it is very much worth it for long periods of use. There is so much more air volume it makes the job much easier.
customer_reviews.author: NickyV

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Powerful but kind of heavy. Not for home use if you have a small lawn which is what I have.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware- defective product
customer_reviews.text: I received this blower at the end of April 2020 and it is august 7 2020 and it does not work. This started 2 weeks ago and when it would fire I checked the spark plug and changed it. It still does not start. I have contacted the buyer and was told it is out of warranty. Beware of this buyer selling defective products with zero customer service .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: This unit works awesome. I live in an areas surrounded by oak trees on about 2 acres of cleared lawn. I'm able to clear the yard of leaves in 2 hours on 1-2 tanks of gas, rather than mowing/mulching the leaves and unloading the bagger every 20 feet whilst burning 10 gallons of fuel. Lifts and blows layers of dead, wet, oak leaves with little effort. No more picking-up sticks (and small branches) as this unit moves them just as easily as leaves. Design is nice and doesn't strain your back; granted it would be nice to be able to start the unit with it on your back, but that's just not feasible. Great purchase, and I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Avery Menefee

customer_reviews.title: choke issue
customer_reviews.text: Never ran without choke on... told Amazon and they said to keep it and shipped out a new one. Now I have two that don't run without choke on. Had to take it to a Husqvarna NOT close to my house. What a hassle..... to be continued
customer_reviews.author: Uncle

customer_reviews.title: This blower ran fantastic for the first four minutes
customer_reviews.text: This blower ran fantastic for the first four minutes. Then it slowed down to idle and the throttle trigger was of no use. I used premium gas as directed and husqvarna oil. This company makes great engines, therefore, I was disappointed. Maybe I got a lemon. It happens.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo

customer_reviews.title: More problems then it's worth
customer_reviews.text: We have been extremely disappointed in the quality of this blower. It is less then a year old and has spent more time in the shop then out of it. It stopped working within the first 3 months and husqvarna would not cover the repairs at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jane K. Atticks

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for the first time last weekend and it worked pretty good. I'm not sure it is as powerful as one from another manufacturer that I used last year, but it is definitely more powerful than a handheld unit. I was impressed because I was not worn out after using it, and my arm was not numb from vibrations. The handle locks "on" so you don't even need to keep squeezing the trigger...just guide the pipe in the direction you want to blow leaves - it is very simple and easy to use. For the price, this is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Good blower for the money, but disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived within the week as described. 3 times since I used it, a bit of metal has wedged in the sparkplug gap causing the motor to stop. I had to remove the plug and remove the bit. Just a sign of poor workmanship on the part of Husqvarna and not the vendor. The belt pads seem to be on upside down. A minor adjustment but disappointing. The most annoying thing is, no foot pad or hand rest to hold the blower when pulling the starter cord. Otherwise it is a good blower and can blow a good pile of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: GBishopjk

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine
customer_reviews.text: I've been using for about 18 months and it's been great. I use it for blowing leaves (it will move leaves that are somewhat wet), clearing lawn clippings, and for blowing away even several inches of light powdery snow. It starts easily, is powerful, and doesn't have the high-pitched whine produced by other blowers. I use regular gasoline with properly measured 2-cycle engine oil and a gasoline stabilizer. Not a problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Patton

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack blower
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backpack blower for the money. It's good for heavy residential use and feels like it would also work for commercial use. Adjustable straps help increase comfort and distribute weight to your hips so this doesn't feel too heavy once it's on your back.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Starr

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my hand held blower this Husky is great!
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars but I'm left handed and the blower is for right handers only - LOL! It is easier on the arm for longer jobs than my hand held blower that was pretty heavy and could make my arm sore pretty quick so I would have to keep switching hands. This Husky blower is very powerful, easy to start, and I jury-rigged a L shape tube and blew out my gutters in 1/3 the time it took me before where I would have to use a ladder and move the ladder every minute. Bottom line: Worth the extra money I paid vs. my $125 Craftsman leaf blower.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Cunningham

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 965877502 350BT 2-Cycle Gas Backpack Blower, Orange
product_meta.description:
The Husqvarna 350BT is a commercial styled blower in the popular 50cc mid-size range featuring a new, powerful X-Torq engine. The harness and controls are ergonomically designed for high capacity and ease of use.

AMAZON.COM


Perfect for professional landscape contractors as well as homeowners with large land areas, the uniquely lightweight, mid-size Husqvarna 350BT back pack blower features a new, powerful X-Torq engine for increased power, better fuel economy and reduced emissions. The harness and controls are ergonomically designed for high capacity and ease of use, and throttle controls are mounted on the tube.

The X-Torq engine design reduces harmful exhaust emissions while increasing fuel 
efficiency (see larger image). 

Adjustable handles for superior comfort 
(see larger image). The Husqvarna 350BT back pack blower (see larger image). With its 2.1-horsepower engine and maximum power speed of 7,500 RPM, this blower is able to generate wind speeds up to 180 miles per hour--enough to blow away even the most stubborn yard waste. Husqvarna's patented 2-stroke X-Torq engine technology gives you more power when you need it, and with up to 20 percent less fuel consumption and up to 60 percent less emissions (when compared to a standard 2-stroke engine). 

Comfortably designed for hours of use, the 350BT features an integrated harness that's ventilated and helps reduce load with a hip belt that's shaped to fit the contours of the operator and wide shoulder straps. The handle has an easily adjustable soft grip for optimal maneuvering. 

Its high-volume 42.27-ounce tank can sustain hours of use. It also features a cruise-control function that maintains a constant fan speed, allowing you to complete big jobs without having to constantly regulate your blower's speed. Other features include a an easily adjustable soft-grip handle, intuitively gathered controls, and an air purge function that removes air from the carburetor and fuel system for easier starting. It's backed by a 2-year limited warranty.

Comfortable, ventilated and load-reducing harness (see larger image). KEY SPECIFICATIONS
 * Power output: 2.1 HP 
 * Cylinder displacement: 50.2 cc 
 * Maximum power speed: 7500 RPM 
 * Fuel tank volume: 42.27 fluid ounces 
 * Sound power level (LWA): 104 dB(A) 
 * Weight: 22.5 pounds 
 * Harness: Integrated 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Husqvarna gas-powered blower, integrated harness, and manual

HUSQVARNA: EXCEPTIONAL PRODUCTS FOR EXCEPTIONAL YARDS
Great yards demand equipment that is as dedicated and hardworking as you are. Fortunately, Husqvarna's range of garden equipment offers everything from lawnmowers and snow blowers to trimmers and chainsaws that let you master your slice of the great outdoors. With Husqvarna, it's easy to make your yard the envy of the neighborhood. Founded in Sweden in 1689, Husqvarna is one of the world's oldest companies.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Husqvarna 350BT is a unique lightweight back pack blower with the large landowner in mind. This popular 50 cc mid-size blower features a new, powerful X-TORQ engine for increased power, better fuel economy and reduced emissions. The harness and controls are ergonomically designed for high capacity and ease of use. Throttle controls are mounted on the tube.

See more
feature_bullets: X-torque engine: the x-torque engine design reduces harmful exhaust emissions by up to 60% and increases fuel efficiency by up to 20%
Utilize full blow force with minimal Arm strain: The offset handle makes the blow forces easier to control By preventing the arm from being pulled downwards
Lowvib: dampeners between the engine and chassis effectively reduce vibrations. Idling speed: 2200 RPM
Ergonomic harness system: Padded harness and hipbelt is shaped to fit the contours of the operator
Cruise control: variable speed throttle with cruise control can be set for easier handling.Air flow in housing: 692.17 CFM

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,388 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
